No-nonsense hoagie roll recipe based on this one from Ethan Chlebowski. Adjusted for Colorado mountain altitude and drynessâ€”because baking up here is a whole different game. I basically doubled the oil content to fight off the dry air.

Planning to try this with shortening instead of oil next time, just to see how it holds up. ðŸ§ª

Ingredients

milk: 260g
yeast: 8g
diastatic malt powder: 8g
flour: 400g
honey: 10g
sugar: 5g
olive oil: 40g
salt: 8g

Prep ðŸ§‚

  • Mix and knead until smooth and elastic.
  • Divide the dough into 4 equal parts.
  • Roll each piece flat, then shape into tight tubes (like little baguettes).
  • Let rise until puffy and ready to bake.

Bake

  • Bake at 375Â°F for 20 minutes.
  • Rotate halfway through.
  • Egg wash optional (for shine).
  • Steam optional (for crust).

These come out soft with just enough chewâ€”perfect for meatball subs or Philly cheesesteaks. ðŸ‘Œ
